Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove the 20 years of .NET banner" (#9023) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Remove the 20 years of .NET banner" (#9023) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[Hotfix] Only allowing lowercase 'tags' element in package metadata." (#9022) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[Hotfix] Only allowing lowercase 'tags' element in package metadata." (#9022) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "Erroneous header tag ".NET Framework 0.0" on some packages" (#9021) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Erroneous header tag ".NET Framework 0.0" on some packages" (#9021) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[TFM Badges][UI] Add tooltip on badges." (#9020) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Since we wanted to improve the experience of users on what badges means, we added tooltip for the badges, this will show one of two messages depending if the badge contains a version or if it's an empty version.

* When clicking the badge the tooltip will take 2 seconds to hide, it was one second before and it was just to short for users to read it.
* Added role button for better A11y experience.
* Verified that Narrator/NVDA reads the tooltip when traversing the page.

### Screenshots
#### With version
![Badge with version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17834924/155606204-7ac2ed42-4653-4ed4-a1fa-2bb8e589b3f9.png)

#### Empty version
![Package with empty version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17834924/155606224-2ecba0bf-82cc-4b9f-b045-f4c82a60d0e0.png)

Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4230.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Show transitive origins in `dotnet list package --include-transitive`" (#11625) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

#### Command

```
> dotnet list package --include-transitive
```

#### Output

```
Project 'projectA' has the following package references
   [net6.0]:
   Transitive Package                        Resolved
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.ObjectModel      17.0.0
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost         17.0.0
   > Newtonsoft.Json                         12.0.1
   > Newtonsoft.Json.Bson                    1.0.2
   > NuGet.Frameworks                        5.0.0
   > PeterO.Cbor                             4.5.2
   > PeterO.Numbers                          1.8.2
   > PeterO.URIUtility                       1.0.0
   > projectB                                1.0.0
   > System.Reflection.Metadata              1.6.0

Project 'projectB' has the following package references
   [net6.0]:
   Top-level Package                      Requested   Resolved
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost      17.0.0      17.0.0
   > Newtonsoft.Json.Bson                 1.0.2       1.0.2
   > PeterO.Cbor                          4.5.2       4.5.2

   Transitive Package                        Resolved
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.ObjectModel      17.0.0
   > Newtonsoft.Json                         12.0.1
   > NuGet.Frameworks                        5.0.0
   > PeterO.Numbers                          1.8.2
   > PeterO.URIUtility                       1.0.0
   > System.Reflection.Metadata              1.6.0
```


### Desired Behavior

Add an additional column that indicates which package/project brought a given transitive package. Example:

#### Command

```
> dotnet list package --include-transitive
```

#### Output

```
Project 'projectA' has the following package references
   [net6.0]:
   Transitive Package                        Resolved    Origin(s)
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.ObjectModel      17.0.0      projectB
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost         17.0.0      projectB
   > Newtonsoft.Json                         12.0.1      projectB
   > Newtonsoft.Json.Bson                    1.0.2       projectB
   > NuGet.Frameworks                        5.0.0       projectB
   > PeterO.Cbor                             4.5.2       projectB
   > PeterO.Numbers                          1.8.2       projectB
   > PeterO.URIUtility                       1.0.0       projectB
   > projectB                                1.0.0       projectB
   > System.Reflection.Metadata              1.6.0       projectB

Project 'projectB' has the following package references
   [net6.0]:
   Top-level Package                      Requested   Resolved
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost      17.0.0      17.0.0
   > Newtonsoft.Json.Bson                 1.0.2       1.0.2
   > PeterO.Cbor                          4.5.2       4.5.2

   Transitive Package                        Resolved   Origin(s)
   > Microsoft.TestPlatform.ObjectModel      17.0.0     Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost/17.0.0
   > Newtonsoft.Json                         12.0.1     Newtonsoft.Json.Bson/1.0.2;Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost/17.0.0
   > NuGet.Frameworks                        5.0.0      Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost/17.0.0
   > PeterO.Numbers                          1.8.2      PeterO.Cbor/4.5.2
   > PeterO.URIUtility                       1.0.0      PeterO.Cbor/4.5.2
   > System.Reflection.Metadata              1.6.0      Microsoft.TestPlatform.TestHost/17.0.0
```


### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Show transitive dependencies from project references in PM UI Installed Tab" (#11624) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### The Elevator Pitch

In PM UI, show transitive dependencies from referenced projects.

That way, users can see transitive dependencies that indirectly affect their current project.

### Additional Context and Details

Issue filed from PR comment https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4465#discussion_r809593140

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Responsiveness] Package Management UI can consume large number of threads all searching the disk (up to 316 threads), use cancellation token at subroutines" (#11599) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Tracking issue for: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1424937
I added `Around The World` tag here since internal issue has one.
Currently passed cancellation token to [LocalPackageSearchResource.SearchAsync](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/ac2cb86d726e1f0089fc6f5a63357a37940ca8aa/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/LocalRepositories/LocalPackageSearchResource.cs#L30) is not checked frequently also getting list of directories once then do processing, resulting fire off very slow thread which is not cancelled even calling method already requested cancellation, instead we could check cancellation token more frequently while processing directories one by one.

Sample look:
![LockingThreads](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/154781668-e1fad1b5-9ff3-4956-9683-275e5ba5e0f8.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet again throwing exceptions "authors is required" "description is required", ignoring csproj/nuspec replacement tokens" (#9954) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Maintainer edit

If you are still seeing this issue with the latest NuGet.exe version, please *unblock* the executable. 

See: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9954#issuecomment-754952859

## Original report
For previous history on this problem, see issue [#4234](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4234).

Using the exact same project and build:

NuGet Version 5.6.0.6591 does not display the Authors/Description error.  However, version 5.7.0.6726 does. 

I'm surprised this important issue doesn't seem to be regression tested. It's fixed, it comes back, it's fixed. . . .

**5.6 output**  
```
nuget pack -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.6.0.6591
Attempting to build package from 'ClassLibrary1.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.7.0.37604' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\MSBuild\Current\Bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'C:\Users\charl\Google Drive\Development\NuGet Testing\NuGet Dependency Resolution\Framework Major-Numbered\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\bin\Debug'.
Using 'ClassLibrary1.nuspec' for metadata.
Add file 'C:\Users\charl\Google Drive\Development\NuGet Testing\NuGet Dependency Resolution\Framework Major-Numbered\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\bin\Debug\ClassLibrary1.dll' to package as 'lib\net472\ClassLibrary1.dll'

Id: ClassLibrary1
Version: 1.0.0
Authors: C
Description: D
Dependencies:

Added file '[Content_Types].xml'.
Added file '_rels/.rels'.
Added file 'ClassLibrary1.nuspec'.
Added file 'lib/net472/ClassLibrary1.dll'.
Added file 'package/services/metadata/core-properties/0a9c65c5d99145c6af36a7c3d0d48724.psmdcp'.

Successfully created package 'C:\Users\charl\Google Drive\Development\NuGet Testing\NuGet Dependency Resolution\Framework Major-Numbered\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1.1.0.0.nupkg'.
```

**5.7 output**   
```
nuget pack -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.7.0.6726
Attempting to build package from 'ClassLibrary1.csproj'.
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.7.0.37604' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Community\MSBuild\Current\Bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Packing files from 'C:\Users\charl\Google Drive\Development\NuGet Testing\NuGet Dependency Resolution\Framework Major-Numbered\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\bin\Debug'.
Could not load file or assembly 'file:///C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet CLI\nuget.exe' or one of its dependencies. Operation is not supported. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131515)
Using 'ClassLibrary1.nuspec' for metadata.
Authors is required.
Description is required.
System.Exception: Authors is required.
Description is required.
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.Validate(Manifest manifest)
   at NuGet.Packaging.Manifest.ReadFrom(Stream stream, Func`2 propertyProvider, Boolean validateSchema)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.ProcessNuspec(PackageBuilder builder, String basePath)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.ProjectFactory.CreateBuilder(String basePath, NuGetVersion version, String suffix, Boolean buildIfNeeded, PackageBuilder builder)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildFromProjectFile(String path)
   at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.RunPackageBuild()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PackCommand.ExecuteCommand()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.ExecuteCommandAsync()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Automatic credential plugin discovery is broken when 64 bit msbuild.exe is used by nuget.exe" (#11623) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

6.1

### Worked before?

Yes, with VS 2019 msbuild 

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Configure a project with an azure artifacts feed. 
2. Restore

Expected:
NuGet.exe automatically discovers the plugin shipped with msbuild.

Actual:
NuGet.exe does not automatically discover the plugin shipped with VS. 
The problem is that 64 bit msbuild is used by default and it changes the relative path so pluigin discovery fails. 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Closed issue "VS PMUI is ignoring cancellation exception" (#11622) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Follow up on [comment](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4471/files#r814926714). It looks like PMUI is swallowing the OperationCanceledException in PackageManagerControl.xaml.cs. Most likely we should emit fault telemetry.
To repro this, select large local package source from source selection then quickly switch between different PMUI tabs.

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/70727217-086b-4d31-ae8f-eadea8be5ac3)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Align Release Label comparison to other package managers" (#11621) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently, Release Labels are compared case insensitive:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/7a5b0aafd767d105014c995378a1dbb71a5d86bd/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Versioning/VersionComparer.cs#L330:L331

When using for example `gitversion` to version commits and therefore NuGet packages, following scenario can appear:
* 1.0.0-alpha.1
* 1.0.0-beta.2
* 1.0.0-PullRequest.4

GitVersion creates the `PullRequest` Release Label uppercase, so that it will always be lower than `alpha` or `beta`, as following is true for most package managers: `0 < ... < 9 < A < ... < Z < a < ... < z`.
Therefore, `PullRequest` builds will correctly be considered lower than `alpha` packages.

By using `StringComparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase.Compare(version1, version2)` this advantage is taken away as `PullRequest` will be considered higher than `alpha` when compared with `OrdinalIgnoreCase.Compare`.

### Desired Behavior

NuGet should do the comparison of Release Labels the same way as other package managers are doing it:
`0 < ... < 9 < A < ... < Z < a < ... < z`.
By using [`StringComparer.Ordinal`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.stringcomparer.ordinal?view=net-6.0) the behavior would be aligned.

### Additional Context

Other tools used in development:
* [GitVersion](https://gitversion.net)
* Conan

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Click some package, cannot start typing a package version in select version list on PM UI panel" (#11620) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

NuGet Client dev-martinrrm-fix-versions-combobox\6.2.0.452

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

## Repro steps
1. Create a new C# Console Application (.net framework) project.
2. Right-click the project and select ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’ menu item in Solution Explorer.
3. Click settings button, check ‘Allow format selection on first package install’ in General tab and click OK.
4. Go to ‘Browse’ tab, click some packages (e.g.Newtonsoft.Json) and start typing a version in the version list.

## Expected
Click some packages and start typing a package version in select version list on PM UI right panel.

## Actual
Click some package, but cannot start typing a package version in select version list on PM UI right panel as below screenshot.
![Record](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/155710346-21813537-bb48-4376-88c6-79cd2e52b5b7.gif)
## Note
1. The issue does not repro on C# Console App (.NET Core) project.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
